Name: Assembla
Notes: 15-day free trial. Commercial projects with customizable sets of tools and features.

Name: Bitbucket
Notes: Free private repositories are limited to 5 users

Name: CloudForge
Notes: Free private repositories no longer available as of September 2014

Name: Freepository
Notes: Free accounts have web access only.

Name: GitHub
Notes: Free for public, paid for private.

Name: GitLab
Notes: Unlimited public and private repos, unlimited public and private collaborators

Name: Gna!
Notes: Only for projects with a GPL compatible license

Name: GNU Savannah
Notes: Project by the Free Software Foundation.

Name: Google Code
Countries blocked: Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria

Name: Launchpad
Notes: Supports only Bazaar for version-controlled repository hosting.

Name: Ourproject.org
Notes: For free software, free culture and free knowledge projects.

Name: SourceForge
Countries blocked: Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria

Name: Tigris.org
Notes: Restricted to collaborative software development tools.

Name: Assembla
Notes: GXUnit, Hikarunix, HippoMocks, MadSwatter, SnakeYAML, Scala IDE

Name: CodePlex
Notes: ASP.NET MVC Framework, Entity Framework, IronPython, Cosmos , PCSX-Reloaded

Name: GitHub
Notes: Ruby on Rails, IronRuby, jQuery, Moodle, Diaspora, node.js, NumPy, Spring Framework, PHP, Play Framework, Scala, SciPy , PPSSPP , Dolphin (emulator) , PCSX2 , Retroarch, Nestopia, RPCS3 , Xenia, Whonix

Name: Launchpad
Notes: Ubuntu, MySQL (code hosting), BlueBream (Zope 3) (bug tracking), Inkscape, Bazaar, GNOME Do, Drizzle, Launchpad, LiVES (translations)

Name: Ourproject.org
Notes: Hispanic Critical Mass movement, the Kune federated collaborative social network, the P2P Foundation workgroup, plenty of non-software free culture initiatives

Name: SourceForge
Notes: Inkscape (download hosting), LAME, MinGW, Poedit, 7-Zip, Fluxbox, Audacity, ffdshow, EMule, FileZilla, phpMyAdmin, LiVES, Desmume , Bizhawk, Yabause, Mednafen, Fceux, Nintendulator

Name: freedesktop.org
Ad-free: Only for interoperability and shared base technology for free software desktop environments on Linux and other Unix-like operating systems, including the X Window System (X11) and cairo (graphics).
